results.title: Psychological differences between the sexes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and the Family Living”.
Dramatises the way in which a young girl and boy react diversely to similar situations exemplifying some typical psychological differences between the sexes. Emphasizes the girls indirect, subjective approach as opposed to the boys direct objective approach. In marriage these differences can cause misunderstandings.

results.title: Psychoactive
results.creator_credit: William E. Cohen and Paul Steinbroner
results.brief_description: Surveys the effects of psychoactive drugs on the nine systems of the human body, and demonstrates how each system functions and how a drug intended for one body system throws the others into disequilibrium. Based on research and practical experience at the San Francisco Drug Detoxification and Rehabilitation Project.
results.description: Surveys the effects of psychoactive drugs on the nine systems of the human body, and demonstrates how each system functions and how a drug intended for one body system throws the others into disequilibrium. results.title: Psycho (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions, Paramount Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s macabre masterpiece broke all of the existing rules for horror films and filmmakers, set the standard for a generation of new ones and kept uncounted masses wary of entering showers. It remains a benchmark for the technique of audience manipulation. Undoubtedly Hitchcock’s most calculated work, he was ably supported by the extraordinary leading performances of Anthony Perkins as the psychotic motel owner and Janet Leigh as the hapless thief, reinforced by Bernard Herman’s evocatively dissonant musical score. Based on the novel by Robert Bloch.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shamley Productions, Paramount Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock

Based on the novel by Robert Bloch.

results.title: Psycho (1998) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Image Entertainment, Brian Grazer and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Gus Van Sant’s faithful scene by scene colour ‘recreation’ (the term preferred by the director over ‘remake’) of Hitchcock’s classic thriller about the fate of Marion Crane (Anne Heche in the role made famous by Janet Leigh) who, on-the-run with a large amount of stolen cash, stops at an isolated motel run by Norman Bates (Vince Vaughn) , where she meets an untimely end. Cast also includes Julianne Moore as Marion’s sister and William H. Macy as the private investigator she hires to find her sister.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Image Entertainment, Brian Grazer and Gus Van Sant
results.description: Gus Van Sant’s faithful scene by scene colour ‘recreation’ (the term preferred by the director over ‘remake’) of Hitchcock’s classic thriller about the fate of Marion Crane (Anne Heche in the role made famous by Janet Leigh) who, on-the-run with a large amount of stolen cash, stops at an isolated motel run by Norman Bates (Vince Vaughn) , where she meets an untimely end. Cast also includes Julianne Moore as Marion’s sister and William H. Macy as the private investigator she hires to find her sister.

results.title: Psycho (1960) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions, Paramount Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s macabre masterpiece broke all of the existing rules for horror films and filmmakers, set the standard for a generation of new ones and kept uncounted masses wary of entering showers. It remains a benchmark for the technique of audience manipulation. Undoubtedly Hitchcock’s most calculated work, he was ably supported by the extraordinary leading performances of Anthony Perkins as the psychotic motel owner and Janet Leigh as the hapless thief, reinforced by Bernard Herrmann’s evocatively dissonant musical score. Based on the novel by Robert Bloch.

results.title: Psychling
results.brief_description: This film is an inspirational chronicle of one man’s determination to achieve a very specific goal: breaking the record for the fastest cross-country bicycle ride.

results.title: Psychics, saints and scientists
results.creator_credit: Irving Hartley, Hartley Productions and Harvey F. Bellin
results.brief_description: Parapsychologist Thelma Moss introduces the field of psychic phenomena and acts as mistress of ceremonies for a discussion by scientists who are responsible for particular areas of study, such as healing, bio-feedback training, psychokinesis, telepathy, and extrasensory perception. Explains that only recently has parapsychology gained respect as a field of serious scientific consideration.

results.title: Psst! Hammerman's after you
results.creator_credit: D Martin Tahse, Entertainment Media and Jack Regas
